result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason S. Shumpert II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:02 a.m. 
Clerk: Amy. 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry. 
Defendant appears in custody from MCJ with Atty Paige Metzman. 

Date and time set for plea hearing; VRCW.  
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to DRI Count 2 (Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor/Repeater); COURT GRANTS.

PLEA>>
Count 1 (Disorderly Conduct/Repeater): NO CONTEST.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: 60 days MCJ; time served.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge.  COURT grants 54 days credit.  

Adj:  11:11 a.m.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Plea hearing on June 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on June 1, 2022 at 10:20 am.
Final pre-trial on July 28, 2022 at 08:50 am.
Jury status hearing on August 30, 2022 at 01:50 pm.
Jury Trial on September 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No contact with victim(s): J.G.S. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.   Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 2:23 pm 
State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett; Defendant appears by Zoom Video from MCJ with Atty Peter Vu (Special Appearance). 
Reading Waived. Reserve Jurisdiction. 

PLEA: Not Guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: $500 cash bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): JGS.  
- Absolute sobriety from controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. 

BRANCH 3 CASE.
